featured.name: What is Aurelia?
featured.description: Aurelia is a modern front-end framework for building browser, mobile and desktop applications.

featured.name: Creating a Todo App
featured.description: Welcome to Aurelia! This quick start guide will take you through creating a Todo app using Aurelia and briefly explain its main concepts. We assume you are familiar with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.

featured.name: Creating a Contact Manager
featured.description: Now that you've got the basics down, you need to learn how to use the CLI, build a more complex app and get a solid knowledge foundation for real-world work. In this tutorial we'll build a small contact manager app and demonstrate a variety of Aurelia's features as well as learn some useful techniques.

groups.name: Overview
groups.description: Discover what Aurelia is along with its business and technical advantages.

items.name: What is Aurelia?
items.description: Aurelia is a modern front-end framework for building browser, mobile and desktop applications.

items.name: Technical Benefits
items.description: There are many technical advantages to using Aurelia. In this article, you will find a list of points we think are interesting. Taken together, there is no other SPA framework today that can match Aurelia.

items.name: Business Advantages
items.description: Aurelia is open source platform with commercial backing. If your business is going to spend significant money building software, you want to do it on a platform that's committed to you as a customer. You want to be able to form a relationship with your technology provider to ensure that you and your developers have a solid platform upon which to build your business now and in the years to come.

groups.name: Tutorials
groups.description: Step-by-step tutorials teaching you how to build your first Aurelia applications.

items.name: Creating a Todo App
items.description: Welcome to Aurelia! This quick start guide will take you through creating a Todo app using Aurelia and briefly explain its main concepts. We assume you are familiar with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.

items.name: Creating a Contact Manager
items.description: Now that you've got the basics down, you need to learn how to use the CLI, build a more complex app and get a solid knowledge foundation for real-world work. In this tutorial we'll build a small contact manager app and demonstrate a variety of Aurelia's features as well as learn some useful techniques.

groups.name: Fundamentals
groups.description: After you've completed the quick starts, learn more about Aurelia's app model, components, dependency injection and more.

items.name: App Config and Startup
items.description: In this article you'll learn the various ways to bootstrap and configure Aurelia, along with different mechanisms for controlling the initial render strategy.

items.name: Creating Components
items.description: Components are the basic building blocks of all Aurelia applications. In this article you'll learn how to build basic components using dependency injection and the component lifecycle.

items.name: Dependency Injection
items.description: Learn about how to leverage Aurelia's dependency injection container, the power behind all object creation in Aurelia applications.

items.name: Securing Your App
items.description: It's important to secure your application. This article will address a couple of simple things you can do to improve the security of your application.

items.name: Cheat Sheet
items.description: Forgot the syntax for bindings? Need to know how to create a custom attribute? This article contains answers to questions like those as well as a bunch of quick snippets for common tasks.

groups.name: Binding
groups.description: Learn all about Aurelia's powerful data-binding engine.

items.name: Binding Basics
items.description: The basics of data-binding with Aurelia.

items.name: Class and Style
items.description: Data-binding class and style attributes with Aurelia.

items.name: Binding Checkboxes
items.description: Data-binding checkbox inputs with Aurelia.

items.name: Binding Radios
items.description: Data-binding radio inputs with Aurelia.

items.name: Binding Selects
items.description: Data-binding select elements with Aurelia.

items.name: Delegate vs. Trigger
items.description: When to use delegate and when to use trigger.

items.name: Computed Properties
items.description: Data-binding computed properties with Aurelia.

items.name: Value Converters
items.description: An overview of the Aurelia binding engine's value converter functionality. Value converters are used to transform data during the data-binding process, both to and from the view.

items.name: Binding Behaviors
items.description: An overview of the Aurelia binding engine's binding behavior functionality. Binding Behaviors are used to plug into a binding instance's lifecycle and change the way it operates.

items.name: Observable Properties
items.description: Data-binding observable properties with Aurelia.

items.name: How it Works
items.description: How data-binding works in Aurelia.

groups.name: Templating
groups.description: Learn all about Aurelia's powerful templating engine.

items.name: Templating Basics
items.description: A basic guide to using Aurelia's templating engine.

items.name: HTML Behaviors
items.description: An overview of the Aurelia templating engine's custom attribute and custom element functionality, including not only how to create basic versions, but how to use them both locally and globally in your application.

items.name: Custom Attributes
items.description: An overview of the Aurelia templating engine's custom attribute functionality. Custom Attributes are used to add custom behaviors to DOM elements.

items.name: Custom Elements
items.description: An overview of the Aurelia templating engine's custom element functionality basics. Custom Elements are used to add custom components to Aurelia applications.

items.name: Content Projection
items.description: An overview of the Aurelia templating engine's custom element content projection functionality.

items.name: Dynamic UI Composition
items.description: An overview of Aurelia's dynamic template composition functionality.

groups.name: Routing
groups.description: Learn how to setup and configure Aurelia's router.

items.name: Router Configuration
items.description: This article covers Aurelia's router configuration.

groups.name: Plugins
groups.description: Learn about Aurelia's officially supported plugins and how to use them.

items.name: HTTP
items.description: Usually JavaScript applications need to get their data from or communicate with various web services. In this article we'll take a look at the options Aurelia makes available to you.

items.name: Validation
items.description: The basics of validation with Aurelia.

items.name: I18N
items.description: Getting Started with I18N in your Aurelia App.

items.name: Dialog
items.description: The basics of the dialog plugin for Aurelia.

groups.name: Integration
groups.description: Learn how to integrate Aurelia with various other libraries and frameworks.

items.name: Integrating with Polymer
items.description: Polymer is a library for creating reusable web components declaratively with extra features like data binding and property observation. In many ways, it is similar to Aurelia's component support. However, Polymer also includes an extensive catalog of custom elements for everything from material design to credit card forms to embedding Google services like Google Maps and YouTube. With a bit of work, these components can be incorporated into Aurelia applications as well.

groups.name: Testing
groups.description: Learn all about testing Aurelia apps, including component testing and e2e testing.

items.name: Testing Components
items.description: An overview of how to unit test Custom Elements and Custom Attributes.

items.name: End-to-End Testing
items.description: Testing front-end applications has become an important task for today's developers. Not only do you want to ensure that your application's internal code operates correctly, but you also want to validate the in-browser behavior. This article will show you how to achieve this by combining Aurelia and Protractor.

groups.name: Build Systems
groups.description: Learn about the various build setups that Aurelia supports out-of-the-box.

items.name: The Aurelia CLI
items.description: Learn how to get setup with the Aurelia CLI and use its basic capabilities.

items.name: Webpack Setup
items.description: If you're interested in getting setup with Webpack to build projects, this article will take you through setting up both your machine and a production quality starter project.

items.name: Webpack Bundling
items.description: Before deploying your app to production, you'll want to bundle the assets for efficient use of the network.

items.name: JSPM Setup
items.description: If you're interested in getting setup with JSPM to build projects, this article will take you through setting up both your machine and a production quality starter project.

items.name: JSPM Bundling
items.description: Before deploying your app to production, you'll want to bundle the assets for efficient use of the network.
